text: Louisville and Nashville Railroad Station, also known as L & N Station, was a historic train station located in downtown Evansville, Indiana. It was built in 1902 for the Louisville and Nashville Railroad, and was a Richardsonian Romanesque style rock-faced limestone building. It consisted of a three-story central block with two-story flanking wings, and a one-story baggage wing. It had projecting gabled pavilions and a slate hipped roof. Note: This includes , and Accompanying photographs It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1979 and delisted in 1985. ==References== Category:Former National Register of Historic Places in Indiana Category:Railway stations on the National Register of Historic Places in Indiana Category:Richardsonian Romanesque architecture in Indiana Category:Railway stations in the United States opened in 1902 Category:Buildings and structures in Evansville, Indiana Category:National Register of Historic Places in Evansville, Indiana Evansville Category:Transportation buildings and structures in Vanderburgh County, Indiana
title: Louisville and Nashville Railroad Station (Evansville, Indiana)
